ygData.subject: Re: WS-REST2016 is looking for your API work
ygData.msgSnippet: Dear all, Just to let you know that the WS-REST2016 deadline has been extended to 30 March, and that accepted papers will be published with Springer LNCS. So

From: Ruben Verborgh <ruben.verborgh@...>

Dear all,

Just to let you know that the WS-REST2016 deadline has been exte=
nded to 30 March,
and that accepted papers will be published with Springer =
LNCS.

So if you have something interesting, please consider submitting :-)=


Best,

Ruben

On 05 Feb 2016, at 13:11, Ruben Verborgh <ruben.verborgh@ug=
ent.be> wrote:

> Dear all,
> 
> WS-REST2016 is a workshop at the Internati=
onal Conference on Web Engineering,
> taking place on 9 June 2016 in Lugano=
, Switzerland.
> You contribution to this workshop is most welcome!
> 
> WS=
-REST2016 Workshop =96 http://ws-rest.org/2016/
>    Submission: 16 March 2=
016
>    Notification: 29 April 2016
>    Workshop: 9 June 2016
> 
> We esp=
ecially welcome research and engineering work in the following areas:
> 
> =
=96 hypermedia-driven client/server applications
> =96 Web API clients that=
 make use of controls and context in server responses
> =96 Web APIs, platf=
orms, and protocols for the Web of Things
> =96 strategies to tackle the tr=
emendous growth and heterogeneity of APIs
> =96 analyses and studies around=
 the practical, social, and economic factors surrounding the development, u=
se, and adoption of Web APIs and mashups
> =96 lessons learned from the dep=
loyment, maintenance and evolution of Web APIs and mashups
> =96 automated =
discovery, profiling, and testing of Web APIs
> =96 dynamic combination of =
and interactions between Web APIs
> 
> In addition to the topics above, thi=
s workshop is also open to:
> 
> =96 applications of the REST architectural=
 style to novel domains
> =96 design patterns and anti-patterns for Web API=
s
> =96 automated Web API composition
> =96 inverted REST (REST for push ev=
ents)
> =96 integration of pub/sub with REST
> =96 REST-compliant transacti=
on models
> =96 frameworks for Web API implementation and consumption
> =96=
 modeling Web APIs
> =96 resource design and granularity
> =96 evolution, v=
ersioning, and extension of Web APIs
> =96 REST protocols beyond HTTP
> 
> =
We welcome full papers (up to 12 pages) and vision/demo/poster/breaking res=
earch papers (up to 6 pages), size counted in LNCS format. Contacts with Sp=
ringer are in progress to publish ICWE workshop papers in a ICWE 2016 satel=
lite event post-proceedings as Lecture Notes in Computer Science. Using the=
 LNCS template is the fast track to the camera-ready version, but we accept=
 publications in other formats, such as HTML or EPUB.
> 
> Details and subm=
ission: http://ws-rest.org/2016/call-for-papers/
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Ruben / =
Thomas / Carlos
> WS-REST2016 organizers
